attributes.action: Save pilgrim hospital boston Lincolnshire. We have a growing population.
attributes.additional_details:
My son needed hoapitilation after an mmri jab. He and many other children were diagnosed with viral meningitis. We had to move our children who had been seen into the adjoining ward, which wS closed, to allow the staff to keep admitting new cases.
The inoculation batch was deemed at fault. These other children were going to be sent all over and into next counties. 
This is Not good enough
attributes.background: Lincolnshire requires more beds and wards and A and E. Not less. We are the biggest county, countryside, area. Travelling hours to reach another hospital would be causing deaths

rejection.details:
We were very sorry to read about your son's hospitalisation. We do hope he is okay. 

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issues you raise. Specific hospitals are the responsibility of the hospital's management and the local NHS Trust, not the UK Government or Parliament. You could contact United Lincolnshire Hospitals’ Trust directly about this issue. You can find out how to contact them here: https://www.ulh.nhs.uk/contact/
